overview:
Armando is an entrepreneur in the fields of aviation technology, niche-market publishing and education.

In the late 70s, he founded The Washington Consulting Group, Inc., a company specializing in air traffic control technology and training. WCG trained most US air traffic controllers between 1986 and 2008, and helped expand air traffic capacity in China, Iraq and other countries. The company reached 1100 employees and $50MM in revenues in 2009.

Chapelli founded El Tiempo Latino newspaper to serve the Spanish-speaking community in the Washington, DC area. With the motto, “a bridge to the mainstream”, the paper became one of the leading Spanish-language publications in the country. In 2004, he sold the newspaper to the Washington Post Company, where it has thrived since.

Currently, Chapelli is providing seed capital and angel consulting to Prepworks, LLC, a leader in online instruction technology. Prepworks has developed, deployed and proved an advanced online test preparation product that educators throughout South Florida are making available to students in grades 6 - 12 to strengthen core knowledge and college readiness.
